item.title: Best HD-2D JRPGs, Ranked
item.description:
In recent years, Square Enix has been releasing remakes of classic games and new JRPGs using HD-2D graphics, developed and owned by the company. The term was coined when Square released Octopath Traveler for Nintendo Switch in 2018 and consists of 2D characters moving through high-quality backgrounds as a tribute to classic pixel art games.

However, the visual style is not exclusive to the company, and various games have been and are being developed with this graphic style to the delight of fans of one of the greatest video game genres. For players looking to check out some great HD-2D JRPGs, here are some options to consider.

10 Octopath Traveler: Champions of the Continent

HD-2D In The Palm Of Hand

Octopath Traveler: Champions of the Continent is a free-to-play JRPG released for Android and iOS that utilizes the mechanics and visuals of its predecessor, Octopath Traveler . The game features in-app purchase mechanics and touchscreen controls for better adaptation to smartphones.

The game serves as a prequel to the original Octopath Traveler and is set on the same continent of Osterra. In Champions of the Continent , three stories unfold simultaneously, allowing players to follow the adventures of Herminia the "Witch of Greed," Tytos the "Hero," and Auguste the "Playwright."

9 Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes

More Than 100 Heroes With Amazing Visuals

The first game on the list that was not developed by Square Enix but has a graphic style similar to the company's HD-2D games is Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes . Developed by Rabbit & Bear Studios, the game aims to provide a modern perspective on the classic JRPG experience and became the highest-funded game on Kickstarter in 2020.

Players can control over 100 playable characters in a world devastated by war, with their stories intertwining to change the fate of the world.

8 Wandering Sword

A High-Quality Chinese HD-2D

Wandering Sword is not a game developed by Square Enix and is not strictly a JRPG as it is a Chinese RPG. However, players who enjoyed the experience of games like Octopath Traveler and Live A Live might love this title developed by The Swordman Studio.

It features 75 different locations across 5 regions, each more beautiful than the last, with high-definition graphics. The game tells the story of a young swordsman who was captured and left on the brink of death. However, upon escaping his fate, the character embarks on a grand journey to become the greatest hero of all.

7 Octopath Traveler

The Game That Inaugurated A New Era Of JRPGs

The game that inaugurated the era of HD-2D JRPGs is Octopath Traveler . With visuals that caught attention since its announcement, the game was a commercial success, selling over 3 million copies and paving the way for new RPGs inspired by classics but with modernized mechanics.

Players embark on a journey through the game's vast world, taking control of eight characters, each with their own storylines, abilities, and paths. The game's turn-based combat system alongside its rich narrative has garnered praise from both fans and critics.

6 Tactics Ogre: Reborn

A Classic With Enhanced Visuals

Although developed by Square Enix, Tactics Ogre: Reborn does not exactly use the company's renowned HD-2D JRPG visual style. However, it stands out visually and can be a major draw for players seeking classic experiences with modernized visuals.

The game is a tactical RPG originally released in 2010, born as a spin-off of the Ogre Battle franchise. It tells the story of an archipelago called Valeria, which undergoes a power struggle between three groups after the death of King Dolgare, who left no heirs to the throne.

5 Star Ocean: The Second Story R

The HD-2D Style In Different Worlds

Star Ocean: The Second Story R is a remake developed by Square Enix of the classic PlayStation action RPG, revamped with various quality-of-life elements and visuals inspired by the new HD-2D style, although not necessarily using the same technology as games like Octopath Traveler .

The game's story follows the adventures of Claude and Rena, two young people from different realities who meet after Claude ends up on an underdeveloped planet called Expel. Upon meeting Rena, they embark on a journey to uncover the origin of phenomena that threaten all of civilization.

4 Unicorn Overlord

Save The World With Many Allies

Developed by the same studio behind 13 Sentinels: Aegis Rim, Unicorn Overlord is another game that utilizes 2D characters in beautiful high-definition settings inspired by the new HD-2D JRPGs.

The game is a medieval fantasy tactical RPG that puts players in the role of the crown prince of a defeated kingdom who must gather forces across the continent to reclaim territories from an evil empire. With over 60 unique characters, ranging from humans to elves, Unicorn Overlord features complex and addictive gameplay.

3 Live A Live

Live Different Lives In Live A Live

Live A Live was the first classic RPG to receive a revamped version with the HD-2D visual style. The classic, originally released for the Super Nintendo, was brought back by Square Enix with seven heroes, each with their own abilities and lives to experience in different historical periods and locations.

From the Wild West to Imperial China, feudal Japan, and a distant future, players will experience unforgettable stories in what is considered one of the most acclaimed JRPGs of all time.

2 Triangle Strategy

All Choices Matter

Developed by the same team that created Octopath Traveler, Triangle Strategy was announced as a surprise during a Nintendo Direct. The game, which features HD-2D visuals, is a tactical JRPG with a focus on actions and choices within the game that will affect your path through the story and the allied units that will join your cause.

The story revolves around three great powers warring on the continent of Norzelia following an incident that disrupted the balance of forces. The player will need to gather units and engage in battles to capture territories, using the terrain to their advantage.

1 Octopath Traveler 2

The Pinnacle Of HD-2D Enhances What Was Already Good

Considered the best HD-2D JRPG, Octopath Traveler 2 not only repeats the success of its predecessor's formula but also improves on all aspects that faced criticism upon its release.

Developed by Square Enix, the game is set in Solistia, a world composed of two continents during a prosperous era where a true industrial revolution is about to occur, giving rise to new technologies. Just like its predecessor, players will have the opportunity to experience the journey of eight travelers in this world, with their intertwined adventures shaping the fate of the world.

item.title: 10 Most Creative Weapon Systems in Open-World Games
item.description:
Highlights

  • Video games offer diverse ways to approach combat - from medieval swords to futuristic guns, the choices are endless.
  • Unique weapon systems in games like Immortals Fenyx Rising and Hogwarts Legacy add excitement to the gameplay.
  • Creativity is key in games like Fallout 4 and Kingdoms of Amalur, which allow players to customize their weapons for strategic advantages.

Conflict is the heart of any story, and video games allow their players to combat this conflict through a variety of means. Some titles may allow for gamers to talk their way out of a combat situation, but the vast majority of games will prompt the player to go for the weapons-drawn route.

From varied medieval weaponry to technological marvels spouting hot lead from multiple angles, video games allow for drastically differentiating ways to destroy one's foes, and for those looking for an open-world title with a creative weapon system , there are plenty of great options available.

10 Immortals Fenyx Rising

A Fluid Combat System With Weaponry From The Gods

Spawning from Ubisoft Quebec's work on Assasin's Creed Odyssey , Immortals Fenyx Rising blends the mythology of Ancient Greece with the open world of titles like The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild .

However, unlike Assassin's Creed , in Immortals Fenyx Rising , players can wield titan-sized hammers, bows to juggle enemies, and engage with hack-and-slash combat with trusty blades. Beyond this, players also have access to wings, which allow for aerial combat, and god-themed abilities, which empower the use of moves such as uppercuts accented with hundreds of piercing arrows.

9 Hogwarts Legacy

An Expansive Spellcasting System Through One Wand

Hogwarts Legacy had mighty shoes to fill as an original story set well before the tale featured in the original Harry Potter series. However, at their disposal, developer Avalanche Software had access to arguably the most versatile fantasy weapon of all - a magical wand.

Allowing nearly limitless approaches to combat, Hogwarts Legacy players can grab, stun, freeze, and control the minds of their enemies. A vast array of unique spells are available for the protagonist to make use of, and coming up with good magic combos will open up an entirely new world in terms of combat.

8 Kingdoms Of Amalur: Reckoning

Offers A Creative Spin On The Fantasy RPG Weapon System

Creating a unique fantasy title is no easy task. However, in 2012, Big Huge created an ambitious weapon system for Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning , complementing its RPG influences.

Players are provided with a varied selection of weapon options - from greatswords to faeblades, with alternating damage stats -, yet this title sets itself apart with how the weapon systems connect. Players can enjoy slicing an enemy with a dozen dagger slices and then proceed to juggle them in the air with a flurry of arrows to the stomach.

7 Fallout 4

Players Can Use Junk To Creatively Customize Their Loadout

In every post-apocalyptic wasteland, there will no doubt be an outright excess of scrap and junk. In incorporating the scavenging playstyle most gamers adopt in the post-apocalypse genre, Bethesda was able to craft a weapon system that bolstered the already creative destructive abilities of the player.

Using specific materials in Fallout 4 , players can craft sights, magazines, and all manner of attachments to their weaponry. Beyond this, these modifications can also be reused on similar weapon types, allowing for the recycling of older modifications.

6 Dead Rising 4

An Open-World Title That Features Explosively Extravagant Zombie-Killing

Frank West has been haphazardly wielding crafted and found weapons for nearly two decades now. However, in Dead Rising 4 , West's creative combat arguably reaches its absurdist peak.

In this Christmas-themed zombie-killing caper, players can - through discovering blueprints and individual weapons - destroy hordes of the undead in truly fantastical style. While a shotgun may do the trick, players can also turn zombies into piles of cardboard presents with a magical wand, drive a catapult, and don a costume of Street Fighter 's Blanka to electrocute zombies.

5 Saints Row 4

An Asinine Arsenal With A Powered-Up Play Style

Saints Row is a series renowned for its gargantuan selection of obnoxiously wacky weaponry. However, in Saints Row 4 , players can wield those nearing NSFW killing methods while bundling them with the game's advanced movement and combat abilities.

While the series started as a response to Grand Theft Auto , its absurd tone has quickly differentiated it from its competitors. As such, gamers can rarely find another title offering the option to bundle a Dubstep Gun and a pseudo-lightsaber while also allowing for superhero-esque jumps and punches.

4 Cyberpunk 2077

A Gritty-Future Focus On Creative Killing

CD Projekt Red's Cyberpunk 2077 is a title that gamers have many varied views on. However, one area in which most gamers agree is that this science fiction RPG features an excellent weapon system.

The cyberpunk aesthetic allows for advanced weapon systems alongside the cybernetic enhancements of the player. Players can use their minds to hack cybernetic implants and destroy AI drones. However, they can also bolster their firepower by wielding weaponry like snipers that can shoot around corners and SMGs with ricocheting bullets.

3 Metro Exodus

A Modular Masterstroke Of Customizable Weaponry

Metro Exodus is a post-apocalyptic title where what little the player has access to can go a long way. A pistol may initially seem like nothing more than a starting firearm that will soon be ditched for a higher caliber weapon. However, in Metro , weapons can be outfitted with a selection of modifications to adapt them to almost any style of firepower one requires.

As such, players can pull a scope and a stock from their backpack to turn a pistol into a sniper rifle, or they can even attach a larger magazine to create a rapid-fire SMG. This gives Metro Exodus players a great deal of freedom when it comes to how they approach combat.

2 The Pokemon Series

An Elaborate And Cutesy Take On Army-Building

With a nearly 30-year legacy, more than 1,000 individual pocket monsters, and nine generations of titles, Pokemon is a franchise like no other. Including instances of regional and Gigantamax forms, alongside Mega Evolutions, the number of Pokemon throughout the video games balloons.

As such, in gamers' near-constant battling with these catchable monsters, their party of six often takes on the role of sentient weaponry rather than companions. However, many players often treat their Pokemon like pets or friends - luckily navigating around such Team Rocket-like modes of thinking. Though these creatures can be incredibly cute, it's hard to ignore how valuable they can be as weapons, especially since so much can be done to enhance them.

1 The Legends Of Zelda: Tears Of The Kingdom

A Once-In-A-Generation Creative Design Shift

Tears of the Kingdom is not only a competent sequel to one of the most revered video games of all time, but it's also a title with such creative prowess that the industry was in awe upon its release. Through Link's 'Fuze' ability, players can take multiple objects and combine them, and there's a lot more to this feature than one would initially think.

Conventional weaponry can be Fuzed with monster parts and Zonaite contraptions in the overworld. A Keese's eyeball can turn arrows into homing devices, and fire emitters can turn a shield into a fire-hazard/defensive option. There are countless ways for players to get creative with combat in Tears of the Kingdom .

item.title: Modern Warfare 3 Zombies: How to Get the Science Journal
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get The Science Journal
  • How To Upgrade The Science Journal
  • How To Use The Science Journal

Modern Warfare 3 Zombies offers a wide variety of items that players can obtain, many of which can be extracted and stored in the player's stash for future deployments. While many of these items are Schematics, others are strange relics often tied to mission objectives or additional exclusion zones known as Rifts.

Joining the long roster of mysterious items is the Science Journal , a relic that players can begin obtaining after completing the Act 4 Story Mission: Union. Unlike the Giraffe Toy, which players acquire through clear mission objectives, the process for obtaining the Science Journal is more obscure.

How To Get The Science Journal

Contrary to popular belief, players cannot obtain the Science Journal by defeating the Storm Caller. Instead, to acquire the Science Journal, players must eliminate a total of 50 Zombies within the Aether Storm.

The Aether Storm can spawn in various locations, but can always be tracked on the tac map as a large purple-hazardous zone . However, simply showing up unprepared is not advisable, as the Zombies within the Aether Storm are buffed to a tier higher than the zone it occupies. Players should bring a weapon Pack-A-Punched to at least Tier 2 or higher, or a Wonder Weapon like the Scorcher, to increase their chances of success.

Once players have eliminated a total of 50 Zombies within the Aether Storm, a Reward Rift will appear nearby, containing the Science Journal . However, in its initial state, the Science Journal is relatively useless and must be upgraded before it can be used for its intended purpose.

The Science Journal can be extracted and stored within the player's backpack or Acquisition Stash, allowing them to take it into another match.

How To Upgrade The Science Journal

Now that players have secured the Science Journal, they can progress to the Tier 3 Zone to upgrade it. The specific location is the western side of Old Town (F4 on the tac map). Here, players will need to locate a triangle on the ground , stand on it, and shoot three purple runes , each visible from the triangle's position.

If the three purple runes do not appear in this location, then another player has, unfortunately, already activated them. This will mean that players will have to try again in a separate deployment.

Once players have completed this step, a much larger triangle will appear towards a building to the east . From here, progress north, ignoring the two bridges leading to the triangle, and instead head atop the stone structure overlooking the staircase to the Pack-A-Punch. From this vantage point, look towards the triangle.

As they do, a ritual will begin, spawning both a soul box and an area of effect around the player. Endless waves of Zombies will start spawning, and players must eliminate enough within the area of effect to complete the ritual .

While players can leave the stone structure while eliminating Zombies, its advisable to stay put. Watch for a prompt that says "perform the summoning" while standing there. When the prompt appears, hold the interact button . Failing to do so will prevent you from acquiring the upgraded Science Journal.

The area of effect will disappear once enough Zombies are killed, and if players manage to begin the summoning, a series of Hellhounds will emerge. Defeating the Byamawl Hellhound boss will trigger a Reward Rift , one which will contain the gold version of the Science Journal .

From here, players can either hold onto the Science Journal to use within the same game, or extract and save it for another match.

How To Use The Science Journal

The Science Journal is one of four items needed to open a Dark Aether Rift Portal (E4 on the tac map) near the Unstable Rift tied to the Story Mission: Union. To use it, players must place the gold variant of the Science Journal onto one of the Rift Pedestals in the area. Additionally, they will need to place a Giraffe Toy, a Laptop with Stickers, and an Imaginary Friend Drawing on the remaining three pedestals to build the Rift Portal.

item.title: Baldurs Gate 3: Best Weapons For Wyll
item.description:
The unique Tav and Durge characters of Baldur's Gate 3 get a lot of attention, and it's easy to get caught up in the fun of building a character from the ground up and forget the Origin characters. These are the Companions that join the protagonist at their campsite, and should they request it, also join the main character's adventuring party.

Each Companion has their unique questline and story, which the player can experience if they play as their character. Wyll the Warlock is one of these Companions, and he's also available as an Origin character for players who want a more immersive look at his story. Some of the best weapons for Wyll are attainable through his Companion quest, but others are easily found with shopkeepers, as rewards for completed quests, or looted from enemies and other secret locations.

The following recommendations are based on default Wyll and don't apply if he takes certain Feats or multi-classed. Being Human, his race gives him access to certain weapons that aren't normally available to spellcasters.

Updated August 10, 2024, by Kristy Ambrose: Baldur's Gate 3 continues to get attention from fans and critics more than a year after its official launch, and although Larian Studios won't be making a sequel or DLC, updates and bug fixes are ongoing. That means the game can still evolve, and new items can show up for Wyll and his fellow Warlocks. This is a versatile class that can use a variety of weapons depending on the build, and Wyll being a Human gives him even more options. Players can make him a pure magic user, a melee caster, or everything in between.

8 Infernal Rapier

A Possible Reward For Saving Mizora

Quality

Very Rare

Type

Finesse

Damage

Piercing, 1d8 + 2 + spellcasting modifier

Actions

High Spellcasting, Melee Caster, and the ability to cast Planar Ally: Cambion

Not every player finds this weapon because it's hidden behind a DC 14 Persuasion check after a specific line of dialogue, and unless players are new to the game, this is exactly the kind of thing that happens in Baldur's Gate 3 . In the concluding scenes of Act 2, Wyll is sent on another task for Mizora, this time into the Illithis Colony to free one of Zariel's trapped minions.

It's eventually revealed that Mizora herself is the one who needs freeing, and the dialogue choices are slightly different if Wyll is in the party. A choice will come up to ask about a reward, and this is when the Persuasion check happens. It's better if Wyll does this unless the protagonist also has a high Charisma score.

High Spellcasting gives Wyll a +1 bonus to his spell save DC and Melee Caster uses his Dexterity modifier to determine the amount of damage done as opposed to Strength. The extra spell allows him to summon a cambion to do his bidding, which is nice for any character but perfect for a Warlock.

7 Melf's First Staff

Purchased From Blurg In The Myconid Colony

Quality

Rare

Type

Versatile

Damage

Bludgeoning damage

  • One handed: 1d6 + 2 + Strength
  • Two-handed: 1d8 + 2 + Strength

Actions

The ability to cast Melf's Acid Arrow and the Arcane Enchantment ability

Anything that gives a Warlock extra spells is always a better weapon, and several staves in BG3 offer their wielder extra abilities, either in the form of extra spell slots or the ability to cast a spell. Melf's First Staff has the usual abilities of a basic, versatile weapon, plus it grants Wyll the ability to cast Melf's Acid Arrow once every Long rest.

Arcane Enchantment gives the wielder of this staff a +1 to spell attack rolls and spell save DC, which is great for any character. It's easily purchased from Borg, the articulate hobgoblin who is also a proud member of the House of Brilliance. He's currently studying mushrooms in the Myconid Colony.

6 Markoheshkir

Find It In Ramazith's Tower At The Top Of Sorcerer's Sundries

Quality

Legendary

Type

Versatile

Damage

Bludgeoning damage

  • One-handed: 1d6 + 2 + Strength
  • Two-handed damage: 1d8 + 2 + Strength

Actions

Kereska's Favour, Arcane Battery, and Arcane Enchantment

There are very few weapons or armor of Legendary quality in BG3 , and the ones that do exist are difficult to find. Markoheshkir isn't held by a powerful boss or assembled in a secret forge; instead, it's kept in a highly secure vault on the top of the tower that houses Sorcerer's Sundries.

The staff does decent bludgeoning damage, but the abilities granted by equipping the staff are the real strength here. Arcane Enchantment gives +1 to spell save DC and attack rolls, and Arcane Battery lets Wyll cast a spell without expending a slot. Finally, Kereska's Favour gives him the power to choose an element and unlock certain spells and abilities connected to that element.

There are a couple of different ways to access the vault, but they all require a lot of sneaking, trap finding and disarming, and lever pulling. The staff is kept under a dome of energy that has to be deactivated, plus there's another trap to disarm in order to pick it up. Other treasures locked in other parts of the vault include the Annals of Karsus and other treasures.

5 Darkfire Shortbow

Purchased From Dammon At Last Light Inn

Quality

Rare

Type

Simple

Damage

Piercing, 1d6 + 2 + Dexterity

Actions

The ability to cast Haste, Resistance to Fire, and Cold damage

Most of Wyll's character and class builds focus on his spellcasting and melee roles, but for those who want to make him a ranged fighter with a weapon to back him up, an ideal choice is the Darkfire Shortbow. The resistances are great, especially for a Warlock limited to light armor, and the extra spell is yet another bonus.

Haste is one of the most useful spells in the game, and every caster should get it if they can. It gives a character double their movement speed, an extra +2 to AC, and an extra Action per turn. Haste is a level 3 transmutation spell and Wyll can use it on himself and one other friendly target.

4 Duellists Prerogative

Reward For Saving Varna

Quality

Legendary

Type

Finesse

Damage

Piercing

  • 1d8 + 3 + Strength or Dexterity, an additional 1d4 Necrotic damage

Actions

Elegant Duelist, Withering Cut, Challenge to Duel

Not everyone takes the same path when it comes to dealing with Ethel the Hag. If the party killed her in Act 1 and rescued Mayrina, they can find the Hag Support Group in Baldur's Gate, and help her kill the Hag permanently this time.

One of the Hag's victims that needs help is Varna, a young girl that Ethel has "swallowed" and plans to give birth to as a new Hag. There's a twist to saving her, but if our heroes manage it, one of the rewards is the Duellists Prerogative.

The bonus Necrotic damage is just one reason this is a great weapon for Wyll. Elegant Duelist means that rolling a 19 for a hit in combat also counts as a 20, Withering Cut is used to deal a reaction against an enemy, and Challenge to Duel compels an enemy to attack the user.

3 Hellfire Hand Crossbow

Drops From Yurgir In The Gauntlet Of Shar

Quality

Very Rare

Type

One-handed

Damage

Piercing damage

  • 1d6 + 2 + Dexterity

Actions

Hellstalker and Scorching Ray

Players don't have to fight or kill Yurgir when they meet him in Act 2, and can instead do a quest to help him escape from his deal with Raphael. However, if they take this path, they won't have access to the Hellfire Hand Crossbow. There's also the connection Yurgir has to Astarion's questline, so if Wyll is hoping to romance the vampire spawn, he needs to kill the Orthon anyway, and the reward is this very rare crossbow.

Either fight Yurgir so he drops it, or talk him into killing himself and loot it from his corpse. From there, equip it in Wyll's main or off-hand, depending on the build. A warlock with an emphasis on ranged damage can add to that with the Hellfire Hand crossbow, and should the player find another one, they're small enough to dual-wield, another distinct advantage.

Another nice feature is Hellstalker , which adds fire damage if Wyll uses the crossbow while Invisible or sneaking. Scorching Ray gives him the power to cast the level 3 spell of the same name once per Long Rest, and extra spells for any caster are always an advantage.

2 Caitiff Staff

Purchased From Helsik In The Devil's Fee

Quality

Rare

Type

Versatile

Damage

Bludgeoning damage

  • 1d6 + 2 + Strength modifier (one-handed)
  • 1d8 + 2 + Strength modifier (two-handed)

Actions

Arcane Enchantment and Caitiff's Restoration

Even if players don't plan on visiting the House Of Hope, it's highly recommended that theystop by just to see Helsik's inventory. She has the Caitiff Staff for sale, and the party doesn't have to do her any favors to buy it.

Wyll doesn't have a shield proficiency, so it's safe to say he'll be wielding this staff two-handed. Arcane Enchantment gives him a +1 bonus to spell save DC and spell attack rolls, and Caitiff's Restoration restores one empty Warlock spell slot.

1 Harmonic Dueller

Available At Danthelon's Dancing Axe In Wyrm's Crossing

Quality

Rare

Type

Finesse

Damage

Piercing, 1d8 + 1 + Strength or Dexterity modifier

Actions

Mellow Harmony

If Jaheira survived the Shadow-cursed Lands and joined the camp in Act 3, she might lead the player to Danthelon's Dancing Axe as part of her Companion quest. Even if she doesn't, players can still stop by and take a look at Danthelon's wares, and the advantage of coming in without a Harper is that the shopkeep is considerably more polite.

The special ability that is granted by this rapier, Mellow Harmonry, sounds like something for a Bard. However, it's related to the character's Charisma modifier, so it's just as useful for a Warlock. If Wyll can pass a DC 15 Performance check, he does even more damage with his melee attacks according to his Charisma modifier.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Fans Show Off Junkrat and Roadhog Cosplay, Complete With Chopper
item.description:
Highlights

  • Overwatch 2 fans wow with their Junkrat and Roadhog cosplay, capturing the duo's humor and unique details perfectly.
  • The cosplayers' faithful outfits come complete with a functional motorcycle used in their photos.
  • Overwatch 2's community showcases endless creativity through cosplays like these.

Two talented Overwatch 2 fans cosplayed as Junkrat and Roadhog and shared the result online. The cosplay drew attention for its impressive fidelity to detail, and for having two real-life friends portraying one of the most unexpected duos in Overwatch 2 .

One of Overwatch 2 's damage heroes, Junkrat has an obsession with explosives and loves to cause chaos and destruction wherever he goes. One day, he meets Roadhog, one of Overwatch 2 's tanks, with whom he strikes a deal and agrees to be his bodyguard. An alliance is born between the two, who attack the Junker Queen several times until they are exiled from Junkertown. Junkrat and Roadhog are an unlikely friendship in the Overwatch 2 universe, making them the ideal theme for two fans to bring the iconic duo to life.

Reddit user Daddy-T_2525 teamed up with his friend to cosplay as Junkrat and Roadhog, achieving an impressive result. The cosplay depicts the friends in the standard outfits worn by the two Overwatch 2 characters, with Junkrat and Roadhog interacting in different situations. The sequence of photos also shows a real version of the motorcycle used by Junkrat and Roadhog. According to the OP revealed in the comments, the bike is functional, and "carries the two of them around."

Overwatch 2 Cosplay Brings Junkrat and Roadhog to Life

The Junkrat and Roadhog cosplay caught the attention of other players for its good humor and faithfulness to detail, such as the two friends having the same body type as the Overwatch 2 characters. Some of the highlights include the tattoo Roadhog has on his belly, the pants with the same design, and a version of the original shotgun carried by Roadhog on his back. The Junkrat cosplay, on the other hand, received positive reactions from other Overwatch 2 fans because of the funny faces like the character's. It also stands out for details such as the wheel on his back, which Junkrat uses in his ultimate, and the versions of the prostheses that the character uses because he has lost his right arm and leg.

Other Overwatch 2 players have praised the cosplay, which shows the endless creativity of the community. In addition to sharing new ideas for the shooter such as skin concepts and other game features, Overwatch 2 players often dress up as their favorite heroes. There's no shortage of impressive examples besides the one shared by Daddy-T_2525, such as an incredibly detailed Reinhardt cosplay.
